name: Jacaranda
description: Jacaranda is a genus of about 50 species of flowering shrubs and trees in the family Bignoniaceae. Although native to Central and South America, Jacaranda has been planted widely in Asia and Australia.These plants have fern-like, dark green foliage and dense clusters of soft, purple-blue trumpet flowers that make a showy display in spring and early summer. Jacaranda trees can grow up to 32 ft (10 meters) in height, which makes them excellent shade trees or street trees.
meaning: The name “jacaranda” has Guarani origin and it means “fragrant”.The Guarani language is part of the Tupi-Guarani language family that belongs to South America. It is spoken by about 4.6 million people in Paraguay. Guarani speakers can also be found in Bolivia, Brazil and Argentina.
color_description: These flowers come in shades of purple and blue.
